DataElement.preferredName: Target Concomitant Agent Gamma Globulin Immunosuppressive Therapy Vaccination Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicator of whether medication is a targeted concomitant medication such as gamma globulin, immunosuppressive drug or vaccination.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Target Concomitant Agent Gamma Globulin Immunosuppressive Therapy Vaccination
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An object fixed as a goal or point of examination; something to point at; a destination._A pharmaceutical agent other than agent(s) tested in a given protocol that is administered to or used by a subject either prior to or during the study. Supportive care and essential ancillary medications required by a treatment regimen should be clearly identified. A protocol's complete instructions including appropriate indication, dosage, administration route, schedule, restrictions to use, and any other relevant data should be explicitly stated. Concept also refers to substance(s) used prior or during the study that are not specified by the protocol.:A type of globulin in plasma that in electrically charged solutions exhibits slowest colloidal mobility after that of the alpha and beta globulins. All immunoglobulins belong to this group of serum protein._deliberate suppression of immune system function for experimental or therapeutic purposes._Administration of vaccines to stimulate the host's immune response. This includes any preparation intended for active immunological prophylaxis or treatment.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An object fixed as a goal or point of examination; something to point at; a destination._A pharmaceutical agent other than agent(s) tested in a given protocol that is administered to or used by a subject either prior to or during the study. Supportive care and essential ancillary medications required by a treatment regimen should be clearly identified. A protocol's complete instructions including appropriate indication, dosage, administration route, schedule, restrictions to use, and any other relevant data should be explicitly stated. Concept also refers to substance(s) used prior or during the study that are not specified by the protocol.

Concepts.definition: An object fixed as a goal or point of examination; something to point at; a destination.

A pharmaceutical agent other than agent(s) tested in a given protocol that is administered to or used by a subject either prior to or during the study. Supportive care and essential ancillary medications required by a treatment regimen should be clearly identified. A protocol's complete instructions including appropriate indication, dosage, administration route, schedule, restrictions to use, and any other relevant data should be explicitly stated. Concept also refers to substance(s) used prior or during the study that are not specified by the protocol.

Property.preferredDefinition: A type of globulin in plasma that in electrically charged solutions exhibits slowest colloidal mobility after that of the alpha and beta globulins. All immunoglobulins belong to this group of serum protein._deliberate suppression of immune system function for experimental or therapeutic purposes._Administration of vaccines to stimulate the host's immune response. This includes any preparation intended for active immunological prophylaxis or treatment.

Concepts.definition: A type of globulin in plasma that in electrically charged solutions exhibits slowest colloidal mobility after that of the alpha and beta globulins. All immunoglobulins belong to this group of serum protein.
deliberate suppression of immune system function for experimental or therapeutic purposes.
Administration of vaccines to stimulate the host's immune response. This includes any preparation intended for active immunological prophylaxis or treatment.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Concomitant Medication per CDISC CM Definition
